column4: Can anyone tell me how to setup ubuntu so I can vnc in after a restart?
You can always 'ssh' in and start vncserver after you insstall vncserver. You dont need to share teh 'current local viewable desktop'
you then connect via any vnc client.
how?
Or you set up auto login, with the gnome vnc server/shareing enabled.
install vncserver.. ssh in.. how to what part?
how to starting up the server.
install vncserver and run .. 'vncserver'
is one way.
no... you dont run vncserver as root.. its ran by the user sshing in.
so the command is just vncserver?  No flags or anything?
theres dozens of options and flags you could use..
of course, but non-required for what I want to do, right?
but the common way i do it.. ssh to remote, run 'vncserver' , on local machine use 'vncviewer remoteboxip'
i dont know what you 'want to do' other then you asked how to start vnc..
that's what I want to do.
you can set the keyring password to be empty and it wont ask.. it will just auto-allow it.
applications -> acessories -> passwords and keys
sure, but where is the option for that?
right click on one of the items (i forget what)_ and you can change the password. set it to be empty it will then ask that you want to use insecure passwords. say yes
its in that tool.. try the right click menus.
